title: Which one is the best self-insert fanfiction? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a lot of very author-y characters out there, some of them in excellent books. But some of the best that occur to me: And Then There Were (N-One) - Uncanny Magazine is a novella by Sarah Pinsker who several nebula awards for previous stories. I nominated it for a hugo this year. It’s about an insurance investigator who attends a conference for parallel universe versions of herself. Four or five versions were successful physicists who first discovered how that were possible. Most were there just out of curiosity. But they were all ‘Sarah Pinsker’ and one of them had a nebula award like the real-life author. It’s not technically fanfiction but I think it should count :) It’s simultaneously the most blatant and yet the least intrusive self-insert I’ve ever seen. Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality is a story by Eliezer Yudkowsky devoted to explaining ways of thinking to avoid getting trapped in the patterns that most people get trapped in. Whether or not you agree (I love a lot of it but find some of it wrong-headed), it’s very “him”. Gödel, Escher, Bach - Wikipedia by Douglas Hofstadter explains Godel’s incompleteness theorem, by way of Escher and Bach. It constantly illustrates examples with humorous dialogues of two characters, Achilles and Tortoise, based on Lewis Carol’s dialogue in which the same characters are used to explain logic, based originally on the figure’s Xeno used to illustrate his famous “if you can’t go the whole way without going through an infinite number of half way, three quarters, etc points, how do you ever get to the end” paradox. Hofstadter appeared himself in one of the later dialogues.

One of my latest finds is All of Eternity at my Fingertips Chapter 1, a vampire diaries fanfic, which features a villain as the protagonist that I enjoyed every much. Its sequels are not obligatory and the main character is placed in different universes each, but I do quite enjoy some of them, such as the Spy Games Chapter 1, an avengers fanfic. Another Harry Potter fic I’d like to recommend (besides Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality, which Jack Vickeridge already recommended in this page) is Rose Petal Red. The same author also wrote a Hunger Games self-insert, Quell, though it’s still in early stage chapters. Those are the long series/memorable ones I can recall at the moment, but feel free to ask for more recommendations if needed.
